author: MSNBC.com
title: Athletes for activism: LeBron James and others rally support for Black Lives Matter
description:
Journalists Jemele Hill and Cari Champion join Rev. Al Sharpton to talk the current professional sports 
climate amid this moment of protest.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Congressman Al Green Calls For Dept. Of Reconciliation To ‘Cure Racism’
description: Democratic Congressman Al Green of Texas joins MSNBC’s Joshua Johnson to discuss his push for the Department of Reconciliation to heal the nation. In the spirit of President Lyndon B. Johnson who declared the War on Poverty in 1964, Green details that the aim…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'I don’t know what justice is anymore,’ Brooks family attorney on how justice can be served
description: When asked how justice can be served for the death of Rayshard Brooks, family attorney L. Chris Stewart responds "I don't even know what that is and I've been doing this for 15 years. I don't know what justice is anymore.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Defunding the police means reimagining safety legal expert says
description: 'Defund the police' calls grow as George Floyd protests continue--in addition to new protests in the wake of Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed African-American man, being fatally shot by an Atlanta police officer in the parking lot of a fast food restaurant. Judith…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rayshard Brooks family lawyer: What was officer’s state of mind?
description: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed African-American man, was fatally shot by an Atlanta police officer in the parking lot of a fast food restaurant, leading to the firing of one officer, and another being placed on administrative leave. Justin Miller, attorney repre…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Ayanna Pressley: 'Black lives have been devalued from the very inception of this country'
description: Democratic Rep. Ayanna Pressley of Massachusetts discusses the systemic changes needed in order to protect Black Americans, including ending qualified immunity and passing the Justice in Policing Act.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: ‘Defunding the police’ isn’t as radical as you think
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi says reallocating resources from police departments to social services would prevent the unnecessary use of deadly force.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Ibram X. Kendi: 'The heartbeat of racism is denial'
description: Ibram X. Kendi, author of “How To Be An Antiracist,” explains that the first step is acknowledging your complicity.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rayshard Brooks’ attorney: He ended up dead from a situation words could have solved
description: L. Chris Stewart, attorney for the families of Rayshard Brooks and Ahmaud Arbery, says Brooks had “a very polite exchange” with police before he was shot in the back.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Police have ‘failed so miserably at the basic task given to them’
description: Senior columnist for The Intercept and host of “Deconstructed” podcast Mehdi Hasan argues that disarming police would make Americans safer.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: MSNBC analyst Capehart on black girl’s viral police encounter
description: Karens--the internet nickname for white women who call the police on people of color for no reason--and black fears of police encounters, no matter how seemingly innocuous they begin, are discussed by MSNBC analyst Jonathan Capehart. He gives an explainer to …
source.name: MSNBC

title: Legal expert: Police don’t need reform, but to be transformed
description: The police killing of Rayshard Brooks--an unarmed black man--in Atlanta is analyzed by attorney Paul Butler, who tells MSNBC’s Ayman Mohyeldin in for Joy Reid, ‘At the end of the day this is about culture.’
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Ben Carson: Fatal police shooting of Rayshard Brooks is ‘not clear cut’
description: Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson said the fatal shooting of Rayshard Brooks was, “A situation that is not clear cut.” Roland Martin, Host, and managing editor of #RolandMartinUnfiltered reacted saying he would tell Carson to, “Shut the hell …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Activists slam roll backs of transgender healthcare protections
description: Transgender protections for civil rights and equality on the federal level have been reduced by the Donald Trump administration, the very same week that the people of Wheeling, West Virginia elected Rosemary Ketchum to their city council, making her the first…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Actor Sean Penn’s non-profit offers COVID-19 testing at protests
description: As nationwide protests continue, actor Sean Penn wants to make sure demonstrators stay safe. Penn’s non-profit ‘CORE’ is planning to administer free COVID-19 testing at Black lives matter protests as the coronavirus continues to remain a threat.
source.name: MSNBC

title: ‘The way you keep the momentum going is to not let up’: Nationwide protests over police brutality enter third week
description: Nationwide protests over police brutality and systemic racism are entering a third straight week amid a fatal police shooting in Atlanta.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: George Floyd death called ‘sacrifice’ in racial equality fight
description: George Floyd’s killing in police custody is called a ‘sacrifice’ in the equality fight in America, but there is still a lot more racial parity to be developed, politics pundit and author Tiffany D. Cross tells MSNBC’s Ayman Mohyeldin in for Joy Reid.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Policing expert explains systemic racism, route to police reform
description: Systemic racism, its role in policing, and potential paths to necessary police and societal reform throughout America are explored by Phillip Atiba Goff, CEO of The Center for Policing Equity.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Questions remain on unarmed black man killed by NJ state trooper
description: The attorney for the family of an unarmed black man who was shot and killed by a white New Jersey state trooper during a traffic stop last month says the state’s attorney general’s office is not being fully transparent with the family. William O. Wagstaff, II…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'We are done dying': Protests for police reform intensify as election day approaches
description:
After the death of Rayshard Brooks, 27, by Atlanta Police on Friday, protests erupted as demonstrators have continued to call for police reform and justice since the death of George Floyd.
This as Georgia voters were plagued by long lines and faulty voting ma…
source.name: MSNBC

title: Fulton County DA promises to fully investigate fatal shooting of Rayshard Brooks
description: Fulton County District Attorney, Paul Howard, joins MSNBC’s Joshua Johnson to discuss the recent police shooting of Rayshard Brooks in Atlanta, Ga. Newly released video from one of the officer’s body cameras shows the moments leading up to the fatal
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: American historian Daina Ramey Berry on the significance of Tulsa’s 'Black Wall Street' at this moment in time
description: American historian Daina Ramey Berry sits down with MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez to discuss the history of Tulsa’s 'Black Wall Street', and why so many black Americans were offended by the suggestion that President Trump would hold a campaign rally in that city on…
source.name: MSNBC
